message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) because it focuses on natural language processing tasks such as semantic relatedness, paraphrase detection, and classification benchmarks. It could also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) because it proposes a new model for training on a large corpus with continuous sentences. Additionally, it could be categorized under cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) because it uses neural networks for training and evaluation. Finally, it could be categorized under cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) because it involves analyzing adjacent sentences as a neighborhood, which is similar to analyzing adjacent pixels in an image.
